sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SERIPHUS (anc. geog.), one of the Cyclades or iſlands in the Ægean ſea, called Saxum Seriphium by Tacitus, as if all a rock ; one of the usual places of baniſhment among the Romans. The people, Seriphii ; w ho, together with the Siphnii, joined Greece againſt Xerxes, were almoſt the only iſlanders who refuſed to give him earth and water in token of ſubmiſſion, (Herodotus). Seriphia Rana, a proverbial saying concerning a perſon who can neither sing nor ſay; frogs in this iſland being ſaid to be dumb, (Pliny).
